intro: Guatteria megalophylla var. deminuta, commonly known as the dwarf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage, with dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in the understory of tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
